thread.title: John Lewis Christmas advert 2018: Readers react to Sir Elton John appearing in festive ad

author: Jack Elsom
title: John Lewis Christmas advert 2018: Readers react to Sir Elton John appearing in festive ad
text:
Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Forget Brexit, this year's John Lewis Christmas advert has truly got the nation talking.
And like the political drama, people are split over the department store's video.
Posting on our Facebook page, some say they'd rather stick forks in their eyes than watch it again.
Yet, others said they had tears running down their face because they find it so heartwarming.
The eagerly anticipated advert, which focuses on the life of Sir Elton John, has provoked a mixed response on social media including a large backlash from people saying it's not very Christmassy.
Among the most disappointed was Melanie Southall who said: "Rather stick forks in my eyes than sit through that again."
This was a stark contrast to Catherine Morgan who said the advert made her incredibly emotional with "tears running down her face".
Lots thought that the video was good, but that it did not have much to do with Christmas .
Lucy Brown tweeted that she had "mixed feelings" and said "it's lovely, but it just doesn't feel like a Christmas advert, more a promo for Elton John's new tour".
This was echoed by Louise Clark who wrote on Facebook that it was a "great Elton promo but only one thing that looks like Christmas is the tree just in shot at the end". Read More
